abstract: Also, the show “Dirty Jobs” has inspired a line of cleaning products that will be available online and in stores including Walmart.
snippet: Also, the show “Dirty Jobs” has inspired a line of cleaning products that will be available online and in stores including Walmart.
lead_paragraph: Britain’s highest court has ruled that Julian Assange, the activist and founder of WikiLeaks, can be lawfully extradited to Sweden to face allegations over sexual abuse, John F. Burns and Ravi Somaiya write. The ruling, the culmination of an 18-month legal battle, has left Mr. Assange living in limbo in England while arguing that the Swedish charges were a prelude to a possible extradition to the United States to face charges over the release of hundreds of thousands of American diplomatic cables.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Court Rules Against Assange and ‘Hatfields & McCoys’ Pulls in Viewers
